decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings:
Existing Floor Plan, Block Plan, and Elevations of Outbuilding, Drawing No. 2024/35/HRS/101/A, dated 24 April 2024
Proposed Floor Plan, Block Plan, and Elevations of Outbuilding, Drawing No. 2024/35/HRS/102/A, dated 17 June 2024

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The outbuilding shall only be used for domestic purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the dwelling, at 35 Havelock Road and not for any separate residential, industrial, commercial or business use. No kitchen or cooking facilities shall be installed at any time.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework 2023 (Updated) - section 12, Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4 and 7B, policies 1.1 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies D1, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Use of existing single storey rear outbuilding as granny annexe, home office, utility area, gym, and storage space ancillary to main house
